  19. #ifndef CAML_FRAME_DESCRIPTORS_H
  20. ‌#define CAML_FRAME_DESCRIPTORS_H

  22. #ifdef CAML_INTERNALS

  24. #include <stdbool.h>
  25. #include "config.h"

  27. /* The compiler generates a "frame descriptor" for every potential
  28. * return address. Each loaded module has a block of memory, the
  29. * "frame table", consisting of these frame descriptors
  30. * concatenated. Each frame descriptor includes:
  31. *
  32. * - frame_return_to_C(): Whether the return is to C from OCaml, in
  33. *   which case there is no actual stack frame, GC roots, allocation
  34. *   sizes, or debug info.  See caml_system.frametable in the various
  35. *   architecture-specific OCaml/C interfaces.
  36. *
  37. * - frame_size(): The stack frame size, in bytes. All stack frames
  38. *   are word-aligned so we also store information in the bottom two
  39. *   bits:
  40. *
  41. * - frame_has_allocs(): Whether it is the return address of a call
  42. *   into the garbage collector, and if so the sizes of all objects to
  43. *   be allocated by this call. Each size is stored reduced by 1, so
  44. *   that a single byte can record sizes (wosize) from 1 to 256 words.
  45. *
  46. * - frame_has_debug(): Whether we have debug information for this
  47. *   stack frame, and if so the "debuginfo" (source location) of this
  48. *   return address. (If frame_has_allocs(), this is an array of
  49. *   debuginfo, one for each of the set of allocations performed by
  50. *   this GC entry).
  51. *
  52. * - the register or stack frame offset of every "live" value,
  53. *   which should be scanned by the garbage collector if a GC is
  54. *   performed at this point.
  55. */

  57. ‌#define FRAME_DESCRIPTOR_DEBUG 1
  58. ‌#define FRAME_DESCRIPTOR_ALLOC 2
  59. ‌#define FRAME_DESCRIPTOR_FLAGS 3
  60. ‌#define FRAME_RETURN_TO_C 0xFFFF

  62. typedef struct {
  63.   uintnat retaddr;
  64.   uint16_t frame_data; /* frame size and various flags */
  65.   uint16_t num_live;
  66.   uint16_t live_ofs[1 /* num_live */];
  67.   /*
  68.     If frame_has_allocs(), alloc lengths follow:
  69.         uint8_t num_allocs;
  70.         uint8_t alloc[num_allocs];

  72.     If frame_has_debug(), debug info follows (32-bit aligned):
  73.         uint32_t debug_info[frame_has_allocs() ? num_allocs : 1];

  75.     Debug info is stored as a relative offset, in bytes, from the
  76.     debug_info itself to a debuginfo structure. */
  77. ‌} frame_descr;

  79. ‌Caml_inline bool frame_return_to_C(frame_descr *d) {
  80.   return d->frame_data == 0xFFFF;
  81. }

  83. ‌Caml_inline uint16_t frame_size(frame_descr *d) {
  84.   return d->frame_data &~ FRAME_DESCRIPTOR_FLAGS;
  85. }

  87. ‌Caml_inline bool frame_has_allocs(frame_descr *d) {
  88.   return (d->frame_data & FRAME_DESCRIPTOR_ALLOC) != 0;
  89. }

  91. ‌Caml_inline bool frame_has_debug(frame_descr *d) {
  92.   return (d->frame_data & FRAME_DESCRIPTOR_DEBUG) != 0;
  93. }

  95. /* Allocation lengths are encoded reduced by one, so values 0-255 mean
  96. * sizes 1-256 words. */

  98. ‌#define Wosize_encoded_alloc_len(n) ((uintnat)(n) + 1)

  100. /* Used to compute offsets in frame tables.
  101.    ty must have power-of-2 size */
  102. ‌#define Align_to(p, ty) \
  103.   (void*)(((uintnat)(p) + sizeof(ty) - 1) & -sizeof(ty))

  105. ‌#define Hash_retaddr(addr, mask)                          \
  106.   (((uintnat)(addr) >> 3) & (mask))

  108. void caml_init_frame_descriptors(void);
  109. void caml_register_frametables(void **tables, int ntables);

  111. /* a linked list of frametables */
  112. ‌typedef struct caml_frametable_list {
  113.   intnat* frametable;
  114.   struct caml_frametable_list *next;
  115. ‌} caml_frametable_list;

  117. /* a hashtable of frame descriptors */
  118. typedef struct {
  119.   int num_descr;
  120.   int mask;
  121.   frame_descr** descriptors;
  122.   caml_frametable_list *frametables;
  123. ‌} caml_frame_descrs;
  124. /* Let us call 'capacity' the length of the descriptors array.

  126.    We maintain the following invariants:
  127.      capacity = mask + 1
  128.      capacity = 0 || Is_power_of_2(capacity)
  129.      num_desc <= 2 * num_descr <= capacity

  131.    For an extensible array we would maintain
  132.       num_desc <= capacity,
  133.     but this is a linear-problem hash table, we need to ensure that
  134.     free slots are frequent enough, so we use a twice-larger capacity:
  135.       num_desc * 2 <= capacity

  137.    We keep the list of frametables that was used to build the hashtable.
  138.    We use it when rebuilding the table after resizing.

  140.    Some frame tables in the list may have been unregistered after the
  141.    hashtable was built, so in general [num_descrs] is an over-approximation
  142.    of the true number of frame descriptors in the [list].
  143. */

  145. caml_frame_descrs caml_get_frame_descrs(void);

  147. /* Find the current table of frame descriptors.
  148.    The resulting structure is only valid until the next GC */
  149. frame_descr* caml_find_frame_descr(caml_frame_descrs fds, uintnat pc);


  152. frame_descr * caml_next_frame_descriptor
  153.     (caml_frame_descrs fds, uintnat * pc, char ** sp, struct stack_info* stack);

  155. #endif /* CAML_INTERNALS */

  157. #endif /* CAML_FRAME_DESCRIPTORS_H */
